title: McClatchy - Wikipedia
snippet: McClatchy Media Company, also known as McClatchy, is an American publishing company incorporated under Delaware's General Corporation Law. Originally based in Sacramento, California, United States, and known as The McClatchy Company, it became a subsidiary of Chatham Asset Management, headquartered ...

title: McClatchy | History
snippet: What began in 1857 as a four-page newspaper in the dusty streets of Sacramento, California has grown into a digital network spanning local markets from California to Florida, from Washington state to Washington D.C.

title: McClatchy Company Overview, Contact Details & Competitors | LeadIQ

title: McClatchy Company - Ballotpedia
snippet: In 2006, the McClatchy Company purchased Knight Ridder, becoming the second biggest newspaper publisher in the United States at that time.[1][2] In 2020, McClatchy and its affiliated companies filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.[3] The company was acquired by Chatham Asset Management, a New ...

title: McClatchy Media: Contact Information, Journalists, and Overview | Muck Rack
snippet: The McClatchy Company is a publicly traded American publishing company based in Sacramento, California. It operates 30 daily newspapers in 15 states and has an average weekday circulation of 2.2 million and Sunday circulation of 2.8 million.
